meanings.definition: To stand or march in front of a place as a form of protest or demonstration.
meanings.sent1: The group picketed outside the school to show they wanted change.
meanings.sent2: She picketed peacefully in front of the government building.
meanings.sent3: The picketed protest caught the attention of many passersby.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to picket for animal rights was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The picketed line of protesters made a powerful statement.

meanings.definition: To place or post pickets at a location as a means of defense or control.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers picketed the perimeter to protect the camp.
meanings.sent2: They picketed the area with caution signs to warn others.
meanings.sent3: The picketed fence kept the curious animals away from the garden.
meanings.sent4: She picketed the boundaries of her property to mark her territory.
meanings.sent5: The picketed border served as a clear barrier for entry.
